channel.title: A tip when youre deleteing objects
channel.description: Hey. I noticed that when youre deleting objects with -Federexer-'s Deleting Objects, its just adding a nothing to the spot. I didnt add it, but added a few nothings, and then added another object, and it didnt flash. So, if you wanna delete an object, do add/makeGlobalObject for the global objects and the nothing id and then like replaceobject for the walls and stuff with the nothing id. This will prevent flashing when you add an object in place of an existing thing that got deleted. Hope I helped!

item.title: A tip when youre deleteing objects
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.source: A tip when youre deleteing objects

item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Hey. I noticed that when youre deleting objects with -Federexer-'s Deleting Objects, its just adding a nothing to the spot. I didnt add it, but added a few nothings, and then added another object, and it didnt flash. So, if you wanna delete an object, do add/makeGlobalObject for the global objects and the nothing id and then like replaceobject for the walls and stuff with the nothing id. This will prevent flashing when you add an object in place of an existing thing that got deleted. Hope I helped!
